intro: Volkameria, commonly known as the mountain hibiscus, is a genus of flowering plants in the Malvaceae family. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas, particularly in areas with high humidity and warm climates. The plants typically have palmate leaves and produce showy, five-petaled flowers in shades of yellow, orange, and red. Volkameria species are often cultivated for their ornamental value due to their vibrant blooms and attractive foliage. They prefer well-drained soil and full sun to partial shade for optimal growth.
